A Minimal Book Example 1 skyrius Prerequisites

A Minimal Book Example Yihui Xie 2021-02-14 1 skyrius Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandoc’s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/.

2 skyrius Introduction Testas testas testas You can label chapter and section titles using {#label} after them, e.g., we can reference Chapter 2. If you do not manually label them, there will be automatic labels anyway, e.g., Chapter 4. Figures and tables with captions will be placed in figure and table environments, respectively. par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1)) plot(pressure, type = 'b', pch = 19) Grafikas 2.1: Here is a nice figure! Reference a figure by its code chunk label with the fig: prefix, e.g., see Figure 2.1. Similarly, you can reference tables generated from knitr::kable(), e.g., see Table 2.1. knitr::kable( head(iris, 2), caption = 'Here is a nice table!', booktabs = TRUE ) Lentelė 2.1: Here is a nice table! Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa You can write citations, too. For example, we are using the bookdown package (Xie 2020) in this sample book, which was built on top of R Markdown and knitr (Xie 2015).
3 skyrius Literature Here is a review of existing methods.
4 skyrius Methods We describe our methods in this chapter.
5 skyrius Applications 5.1 Example one 5.2 Example two
5 skyrius Applications Some significant applications are demonstrated in this chapter. 5.1 Example one 5.2 Example two
6 skyrius Final Words We have finished a nice book.

References Xie, Yihui. 2015. Dynamic Documents with R and Knitr. 2nd ed. Boca Raton, Florida: Chapman; Hall/CRC. http://yihui.org/knitr/. ———. 2020. Bookdown: Authoring Books and Technical Documents with r Markdown. https://github.com/rstudio/bookdown.
